faq.question: Why recycle?
faq.answer:
Recycling saves landfill space, conserves resource, saves energy and saves water. Recycling is only the tip of the environmental ice burg; reducing your waste and reusing what you have will always be better. However, you may be surprised how much of an impact recycling really has. 
More infomation can be found at http://www.lessismore.org/materials/28-why-recycle

faq.question: What to recycle?
faq.answer:
Many things we use everyday can be reclaimed and remade again. We accept the following:

	Paper - Office, glossy and colored paper, 
	envelopes, cardstock, newspaper, magazines 
	and telephone books.
	Cardboard - Flattened boxes, cereal boxes and 
	paper grocery bags
	Plastic - #1 and #2 bottles (check the bottom 
	for the recycling number)
	Plastic bags and wrap (grocery bags, wrap, 
	etc.)
	Aluminum - Beverage cans, etc.
	Styrofoam - Packing foam, foam cups, foam 
	plates, egg carts, etc. All items must be clean 
	and dry with no food residue.
	Tin or steel cans â€“ coffee cans, vegetable 
	cans, pet food cans (must be clean and lid 
	pushed inside the can).
	Other Items - Housing Services will also take 
	ink cartridges, rechargeable batteries, 
	toner cartridges, computers and other 
	electronics. 

More information can be found at http://www.depts.ttu.edu/housing/gogreen/recycle.php

faq.question: What isn't recyclable?
faq.answer: We no longer accept #3, #4, #5 or #7 plastics.

faq.question: Where to recycle?
faq.answer: Paper, plastic and beverage container recycling bins are located in all the Residence Halls on all the floors. Recycling bins are also found in many academic buildings across campus. Cardboard recycling can be found outside many of the residence halls at specially marked bins.

faq.question: How can I tell which plastics are recyclable?
faq.answer:
Check the bottom of the plastics to see if there is a recycling symbol and number. If a plastic does not have a recycling symbol on it, throw it in the trash to avoid contaminating the recycling stream.
 More information can be found at http://greenopedia.com/plastic-recycling-codes/ 

http://www.goodhousekeeping.com/home/g804/recycling-symbols-plastics-460321/?

faq.question: How clean do containers need to be before I toss them into the recycling bin?
faq.answer: If containers aren't clean, it is better to throw it in the trash to avoid contaminating the recycling stream. Please do not contaminate recyclables with food or wet garbage! For example, a pizza box with sauce and cheese on it should be thrown out with regular trash. If in doubt, go ahead and put the item in the regular trash.

faq.question: Can caps and lids be recycled?
faq.answer: Caps and lids are usually #5 plastics. TTU no longer accepts #5 plastics
